definition: to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: Jamal Malik: The guide book was written by a bunch of lazy good-for-nothing Indian beggars.
sentences.chinese: 那本指南是一群混饭吃的懒人写的。

sentences.english: Don't despise our doctors, we earn our living by handling swords, too.
sentences.chinese: 不要小看我们大夫，我们也是拿刀混饭吃的。

sentences.english: About two weeks ago, with my baby in my arms, I followed his mum to his grandma's home for a free meal.
sentences.chinese: 约两周前，我抱着小孩跟着他妈去他姥姥家混饭。

sentences.english: The thief does not steal the bag.
sentences.chinese: 不偷包，人家小偷怎么混饭吃啊？

definition: to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
to work half-heartedly/to get by in a job with the minimum effort
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
(PRC) flow of people from the countryside into the cities/rural migrant without definite prospects/drifter
